Package entities

Interface MissionI

All Known Implementing Classes:
Mission
public interface MissionI
Represents the structure and behavior of a mission. A mission encapsulates details such as unique code, targets, enemies, items, entry/exit points, and the battlefield. It also defines operations to modify and retrieve these properties.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    CustomNetwork<Room> getBattlefield()
    Retrieves the battlefield representation as a custom network of rooms.
    java.lang.String getCode()
    Retrieves the unique code associated with the mission.
    LinkedList<Enemy> getEnemies()
    Retrieves a list of all enemies associated with the mission.
    LinkedList<Room> getEntryExitPoints()
    Retrieves the list of entry and exit points for a mission, represented as rooms.
    LinkedList<Item> getItems()
    Retrieves a list of items associated with the mission.
    Target getTarget()
    Retrieves the target associated with the current mission.
    boolean isTargetSecured()
    Checks whether the mission's target has been secured.
    void setEnemy​(Enemy enemy)
    Adds an enemy to the mission's list of enemies.
    void setEntryExitPoint​(Room entry_exit_point)
    Sets a specified Room as the entry/exit point of the mission.
    void setItem​(Item item)
    Sets an item for the mission.
    void setTarget​(Target target)
    Sets the target for a mission using the provided target object.
    void setTargetSecured​(boolean targetSecured)
    Sets the secured status of the mission target.

  • Method Details

    • getCode

      java.lang.String getCode()
      Retrieves the unique code associated with the mission.
      Returns:
      a string representing the unique identifier for the mission.

    • getTarget

      Target getTarget()
      Retrieves the target associated with the current mission.
      Returns:
      the mission's target, which contains information about the specific goal or location.

    • isTargetSecured

      boolean isTargetSecured()
      Checks whether the mission's target has been secured.
      Returns:
      true if the target is secured, false otherwise.

    • getBattlefield

      CustomNetwork<Room> getBattlefield()
      Retrieves the battlefield representation as a custom network of rooms. The battlefield consists of interconnected rooms, which may contain items, enemies, or other properties based on the associated Room and CustomNetwork definitions.
      Returns:
      a CustomNetwork object containing Room instances that represent the battlefield.

    • getEnemies

      LinkedList<Enemy> getEnemies()
      Retrieves a list of all enemies associated with the mission.
      Returns:
      a linked list of Enemy objects representing the enemies in the mission

    • getItems

      LinkedList<Item> getItems()
      Retrieves a list of items associated with the mission.
      Returns:
      a LinkedList containing items of type Item.

    • getEntryExitPoints

      LinkedList<Room> getEntryExitPoints()
      Retrieves the list of entry and exit points for a mission, represented as rooms. These points are critical for defining the beginning and endpoints of a mission, and may influence navigation or strategy within the mission's context.
      Returns:
      a LinkedList of Room objects representing entry and exit points.

    • setTarget

      void setTarget​(Target target)
      Sets the target for a mission using the provided target object.
      Parameters:
      target - the Target object representing the mission's goal, containing details such as the room and target type.

    • setTargetSecured

      void setTargetSecured​(boolean targetSecured)
      Sets the secured status of the mission target.
      Parameters:
      targetSecured - boolean value indicating whether the mission target is secured.

    • setEnemy

      void setEnemy​(Enemy enemy) throws NotElementComparableException
      Adds an enemy to the mission's list of enemies.
      Parameters:
      enemy - the enemy to be added to the mission
      Throws:
      NotElementComparableException - if the enemy cannot be added due to non-comparability

    • setItem

      void setItem​(Item item) throws NotElementComparableException
      Sets an item for the mission. The provided item must be comparable.
      Parameters:
      item - the item to be set for the mission.
      Throws:
      NotElementComparableException - if the provided item is not comparable.

    • setEntryExitPoint

      void setEntryExitPoint​(Room entry_exit_point) throws NotElementComparableException
      Sets a specified Room as the entry/exit point of the mission.
      Parameters:
      entry_exit_point - the Room object to be designated as the entry/exit point
      Throws:
      NotElementComparableException - if the provided Room cannot be compared
